title: ValueError: Could not find a format to read the specified file in single-image mode
body:
Hi,
I'm trying create a face recognition model using the following dataset: http://vis-www.cs.umass.edu/lfw/, however,  I cannot start training because of the following error: 
...
>Using training raw csv, no hdf5 and json file with the same name have been found
Building dataset (it may take a while)
Loading training file...
done
Loading validation file..
done
Loading test file..
done
Concatenating files..
done
multiprocessing.pool.RemoteTraceback:
"""
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 119, in worker
    result = (True, func(*args, **kwds))
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 44, in mapstar
    return list(map(*args))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/features/image_feature.py", line 119, in _read_image_and_resize
    img = imread(img_entry)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/skimage/io/_io.py", line 48, in imread
    img = call_plugin('imread', fname, plugin=plugin, **plugin_args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/skimage/io/manage_plugins.py", line 209, in call_plugin
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/skimage/io/_plugins/imageio_plugin.py", line 10, in imread
    return np.asarray(imageio_imread(*args, **kwargs))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/imageio/core/functions.py", line 265, in imread
    reader = read(uri, format, "i", **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/imageio/core/functions.py", line 182, in get_reader
    "Could not find a format to read the specified file in %s mode" % modename
ValueError: Could not find a format to read the specified file in single-image mode
"""

>The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

>Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/ludwig", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/cli.py", line 136, in main
    CLI()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/cli.py", line 71, in __init__
    getattr(self, args.command)()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/cli.py", line 75, in train
    train.cli(sys.argv[2:])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/train.py", line 419, in cli
    train_cli(**vars(args))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/train.py", line 198, in train_cli
    debug=debug,
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/api.py", line 412, in train
    **kwargs,
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/api.py", line 1279, in preprocess
    random_seed=random_seed
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1498, in preprocess_for_training
    random_seed=random_seed
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 243, in preprocess_for_training
    random_seed=random_seed
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1628, in _preprocess_file_for_training
    random_seed=random_seed
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1150, in build_dataset
    skip_save_processed_input
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1293, in build_data
    skip_save_processed_input
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/features/image_feature.py", line 349, in add_feature_data
    read_image_and_resize, all_img_entries
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 266, in map
    return self._map_async(func, iterable, mapstar, chunksize).get()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.6/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 644, in get
    raise self._value
ValueError: Could not find a format to read the specified file in single-image mode

On the other hand, I've created a image classification model using MNIST dataset. I have no idea why I have the above error when using the LFW dataset.

The config file is : 
```
input_features:
    -
        name: image_path
        type: image
        encoder: stacked_cnn
output_features:
    -
        name: name
        type: category
```

and training csv is : 
```
image_path, name
hogehoge, hogehoge
...
```

__Expected behavior__
I expect to clear the above error.

__Environment__
-OS: Ubuntu18(docker, host OS: windows10)
-Python: 3.6
-Ludwig: 0.4
